annotation:
ssh user@fedora-vmWelcome to Fedora 38 (Workstation Edition)!Connecting to a Fedora VM via SSH.uname -r6.1.0-0.fc38.x86_64Checking the kernel version of the Fedora VM.sudo dnf updateFedora 38 - x86_64 - Updates 2.3 MB/s | 25 MB 00:11Updating package lists for the latest versions of packages in Fedora repositories.sudo dnf install -y wget curl gcc makeDependencies resolved.
Installation complete.Installing essential utilities such as `wget`, `curl`, `gcc`, and `make` on the Fedora system.wget https://ftp.gnu.org/gnu/wget/wget-1.21.1.tar.gz--2024-11-14 15:45:03-- https://ftp.gnu.org/gnu/wget/wget-1.21.1.tar.gz
Resolving ftp.gnu.org (ftp.gnu.org)... 209.51.188.172Downloading the source code for the GNU `wget` program from the FTP server.tar -xvzf wget-1.21.1.tar.gztar: wget-1.21.1.tar.gz: Cannot open: No such file or directory
tar: Error is not recoverable: exiting nowError encountered during extraction. The file may not have been downloaded properly.lswget-1.21.1.tar.gzListing directory contents to verify the presence of the downloaded file.tar -xvzf wget-1.21.1.tar.gzwget-1.21.1/
wget-1.21.1/README
wget-1.21.1/configure.acThe user successfully extracts the archive after confirming the file is present in the directory.cd wget-1.21.1Changing the working directory to the extracted source folder of the `wget` program../configurechecking for a working C compiler... yes
checking for make... yes
checking whether make sets $(MAKE)... yesRunning the `configure` script to prepare the source code for compilation on Fedora.makegcc -DHAVE_CONFIG_H -I. -I. -g -O2 -MT wget.o -MD -MP -MF .deps/wget.Tpo -c wget.c
gcc: error: unrecognized command line option ‘-MT’
make: *** [Makefile:486: wget.o] Error 1Error encountered during the compilation. The `gcc` compiler fails with an unrecognized `-MT` option in the Makefile.make cleanrm -f wget.oRunning `make clean` to remove partially compiled files and reset the build environment.sed -i 's/-MT/-c/' MakefileModifying the `Makefile` to replace the incorrect `-MT` flag with `-c` for successful compilation.makegcc -DHAVE_CONFIG_H -I. -I. -g -O2 -c wget.c
gcc -g -O2 -o wget wget.oAfter modifying the `Makefile`, the program is successfully compiled with the corrected flags.sudo make installinstalling `wget` in /usr/local/binInstalling the compiled `wget` program to the system.wget --versionwget 1.21.1
GNU Wget 1.21.1 built on linux-gnu.Verifying the installed version of `wget` by running the command `wget --version`.exitExiting the SSH session after completing the deployment and installation of GNU `wget`.
